State of Michigan
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RICK SNYDER NICK LYON
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 22, 2018
Verdetta Love
Wayne County DHS - Western
27540 Michigan Avenue
Inkster, MI 48141
RE: License #: CP820201497
Wayne County DHS - Western
27540 Michigan Avenue
Inkster, MI 48141
Dear Mrs. Love:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed October 17,
2018. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the policy and ISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP. The corrective action plan is due
15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-4532
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
INTERIM INSPECTION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CP820201497
Licensee Name: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Address: 235 South Grand Avenue
Lansing, MI 48902
Licensee Telephone #: (517) 373-3768
Administrator/Licensee Designee: Herman McCall, Designee
Name of Facility: Wayne County DHS - Western
Facility Address: 27540 Michigan Avenue
Inkster, MI 48141
Facility Telephone #: (313) 934-8910
Original Issuance Date: 05/01/1992
Service Types: FOSTER CARE
INDEPENDENT LIVING
1

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12205 Required staff.
(8) An agency shall employ or contract for a sufficient number of
competent staff to carry out the provisions covered by these
rules. The workload for each staff member shall not be more
than any of the following:
(b) Fifteen children assigned to a social services worker for
purposes of providing direct services in foster care, independent
living, adoption, or post adoption services or a combination
thereof.
The caseload ratio requirement is now 13:1
18/34 foster care workers have more than 13 children
assigned.
(repeat violation)
R 400.12404 Placement.
(7) An agency shall document, in the child's record, within 7
calendar days after placement, the information specified in R
400.12417(1) and all of the following information:
(a) All of the following child characteristics:
(iii) Height and weight.
(v) Identifying marks.
(g) Documentation of the child's placement preparation.
Three of eight children did not have all of the required
documentation.
(7) One placement form was completed 10 months after
placement.
(7) (a) (iii) & (v) Another placement form was missing the child’s
height and identifying marks.
(7) (g) A third was missing the child’s preparation for placement.
4

(repeat violation)
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the child's
record before a change of placement occurs:
(a) – (h)
Two action summaries (DHS-69b) were completed late.
17 and 43 days late.
(repeat violation)
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(d) Current immunizations for each child as required by
section 5111 of 1978 PA 368, MCL 333.5111. All of the
following apply:
(ii) A copy of a waiver addressed to the department of
community health signed by the parent stating immunizations
are not being administered due to religious, medical, or other
reasons is sufficient documentation of immunizations.
Two of eight children were overdue for immunizations.
(1) (d) One child was overdue.
(1) (d) (ii) One child for which the parent refused
immunizations did not have a waiver signed by the
parent.
(repeat violation)
5

R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
Two of eight ISPs were completed late.
5 and 25 days late.
(repeat violation)
R 400.12511 Independent living contract.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living services
for a youth, the agency shall document all of the following
information in the case record within 30 calendar days of
termination of its services:
In one of one IL case, the 90-day discharge report was not
completed until four months after termination of services.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.49 Medical passports must be updated quarterly.
7 quarterly medical passports were missing for 4 children.
(repeat violation)
ISEP 6.33c PATPs must be signed by the parent/guardian.
3 of 23 PATPs were not signed by the parent/guardian.
(repeat violation)
6

3.) The facility is in compliance will all MDHHS policies except for the following:
SRM 103 - Social services workers must have at least 32 hours of training per year.
1 of 6 workers had fewer than 32 hours of training in 2017.
FOM 802 - Mental health screenings must be completed within 30 days of admission.
(ie, screening completed by doctor; or ASQ/Pediatric assessment completed by worker
with scoring key completed and attached to determine whether or not mental health
services are needed)
2 of 8 children did not have a mental health screening within 30 days.
(repeat noncompliance)
FOM 722-08 – Supervisor must sign service plans with 14 days.
1 of 23 service plans was signed late. (84 days late)
FOM 722-08C – PATPs must be signed by relative caregivers
7 of 23 PATPs were not signed by the relative caregiver.
(repeat noncompliance)
FOM 722-6H – Unannounced home visits must be completed quarterly.
3 unannounced visits did not occur for 8 children in 15 quarters.
(repeat noncompliance)
FOM 722-09C – A closing action summary must be completed for terminated youth.
1 of 1 closing action summary was not completed for a youth terminated from IL
on 6/8/18.
7

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Assistance was provided to administrative staff on how to complete the new Safety
Alert/Concerns forms.
V. CONSULTATION
Per MDHHS policy, foster care workers directly supervising children in residential
placements are required to interact and collaborate with the staff at the child caring
institution. It is helpful if workers interact with residential staff and obtain details
about an alleged incident (who, what, when, where and how) before reporting
suspected abuse or neglect by a child caring institution.
The coding key must accompany the AQS and Pediatric assessment. To complete
the mental health screening tool, scores should be tallied by the foster care worker
and a determination made on the form as to whether a mental health referral is
needed. Mental health referrals should be made immediately once deemed
appropriate. The worker should sign and date the form before uploading it.
Licensing Rules for Child Placing Agencies - Independent Living Services apply to
all youth on YAVFC status.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
The agency had no DCWL special investigations during this licensing period.
The following citations and acceptable corrective action plans were submitted
for the Renewal report of 2017:
4.22 MiSACWIS. Mandatory office time is required for SW contacts and to upload all case
documentation.
R400.12205 Caseload compliance has been maintained at 15:1 for direct supervision cases and
90:1 POS cases consistantly.
R400.12404 Five day placement packet information is now uploaded together. Preparation for
placement should be included in uploaded documents.
R400.12405 Complete DHS 69 and DHS 31 forms are completed accurately for change of
placements.
R400.12409 School enrollment verification letters are uploaded into MiSACWIS.
R400.12413 Physical exams will be done timely and documentation uploaded into MiSACWIS.
Immunization records will also be verified and uploaded into MiSACWIS. Dental examinations will be
completed, timely, and documents uploaded into MiSACWIS.
R400.12421 Visits with the child will occur as required per policy and SW contacts entered into
MiSACWIS appropriately.
R400.12418 FC initial and updated service plans will be completed timely.
8

ISEP 6.33c Staff are required to have parent/guardian signatures on uploaded PATPs.
ISEP 6.43 Children are to be screened for mental health issues within 30 days of entry to foster care.
ISEP 6.45 Medical passports are to be signed by the caregiver and uploaded into MiSACWIS
quarterly.
FOM 722-6B DHS 1105 are to be completed and uploaded for every FTM.
FOM 722-8C Foster parents/caregiver signatures are required on all PATPs within 30 days of the
child's entry to foster care.
FOM 722-06H Unannounced visits are required every quarter.
FOM 722-06I Sibling visits for splits siblings will occur monthly.
FOM 801 All medical information required by policy will be given to the caregiver/foster parent.
FOM 802 Mental health referrals are required when identified as needed by a physician.
ANALYST CONCERNS AND RESOLUTIONS
Safety Alert 1
Concern: No unannounced visits have taken place since the children were placed
16 months ago.
Resolution: Unannounced home visits occurred on 9/15/2017, 11/7/2017,
1/26/2018, 3/8/2018, 6/15/2018 and 8/24/18 as required.
Safety Alert 2
Concern: The relative stated that the caseworkers do not make scheduled home
visits every month.
Resolution: Monthly home visits occurred on 10/31/17, 11/29/17, 12/04/17, 01/02/18,
02/21/18, 3/27/18, 04/03/18, 05/22/18, 06/05/18, 07/26/18, 08/10/18, and 9/11/18.
Concern: The relative stated that the caseworkers do not make unannounced home
visits every month.
Resolution: Unannounced visits were conducted on 2/21/18, 03/27/18 and 9/11/18. An
unannounced visit did not occur in June 2018. FOM 722-6H cited above.
Concern: The relative said she was provided with no information about Ineligible
Grantee funds.
Resolution: According to the DHS-3130a, the caregiver was provided with the Pub.457
on 08/06/15 and again on 09/11/18.
9

Concern: The relative said she has never received a copy of a Medical Passport.
Resolution: There is a signed medical passport from the relative caregiver dated
9/11/18. Three required medical passports were not given to the caregiver. ISEP 6.49
cited above.
Concern: The relative said she has never received a copy of a Treatment Plan.
Resolution: The relative caregiver was not provided the PATP that covered December -
March 2018 in a timely manner. However, all PATPs were signed. FOM 722-08C cited
above.
Concern: The relative said she has never received notification or attended an FTM.
Resolution: The relative received notification and attended FTMs on 12/28/17, 3/27/18
and 08/10/2018. No FTM was held during the quarter between 3/18 and 6/18. FOM
722-06B Quarterly Family Team Meetings cited here.
Concern: The relative is not notified of court dates by the caseworker.
Resolution: There is no known policy that caseworkers must notify relative
caregivers of upcoming court hearings. However, the relative was notified of the
hearings on 09/12/17. 01/22/18 and 9/11/18. There was no documentation
verifying that notification was provided for the 05/29/18 hearing.
Concern: The relative and child said there has been no information provided to her
about YIT services or MYOI.
Resolution: The relative caregiver and the youth were provided information on YIT on
10/31/17, 07/26/18 and 08/10/18.
Concern: The relative and child report that she was never informed about nor in
attendance at a Semi-Annual Transition Plan meeting.
Resolution: The Semi-Annual Transition Planning meeting was missed in March 2018
and completed on 09/14/18. FOM 722-06B Semi-Annual Transition Meeting every
180 days for youth 14+ is cited here.
10

Safety Alert 3
Concern: The Caregiver stated that she was not provided with information about any
kind of financial assistance such as Ineligible Grantee funds.
Resolution: The unrelated caregiver was provided the ineligible grantee letter by
CPS via the Pub 457. However, this relative is ineligible for funds because she is
fictive kin.
Safety Alert 4
Concern: Relative caregiver stated that she does not yet have a Medical Passport
for the child in her care.
Resolution: The unrelated caregiver signed the initial medical passport on
04/21/2018. No passport was completed for the next quarter. ISEP 6.49 cited
above.
Concern: Relative caregiver stated that she has not yet signed a caregiver portion of
the treatment plan for the child in her care.
Resolution: The unrelated caregiver did not receive or sign PATPs for reports ending in
April or July 2018. FOM 722-08C cited above.
Concern: The teen reported that he has not yet discussed, reviewed, or signed a
treatment plan with independent living goals and any necessary referrals designed to
meet those goals.
Resolution: The teen did not receive or sign his treatment plans for periods
ending April or July 2018. FOM 722-08C Required Participation in
Development – a child 14+ is required to sign each PATP is cited here.
11

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or DHHS policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
October 22, 2018
________________________________________
Deborah Will Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
m October 23, 2018
________________________________________
Linda D. Tansil Date
Area Manager
12
